result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blake Michael Bonney

records.addlTxt:
10:16 AM Defendant Blake Michael Bonney appeared by phone.  Attorney Marcus M Zimmer appeared by video for Blake Michael Bonney.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Atty def has recv'd complaint, waives reading, asking for prelim hearing waiving time limits.  Def needs to appear by video or have stipulation regarding identification.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
Def not to operate any motor vehicle.
